decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing no. 01 PL (Location Site Plan and Proposed Site Plan ) Dated 28/10/2024
Drawing no. 06 PL (Proposed Ground Floor Plan, and Proposed First Floor Plan)Dated 28/10/2024 
Drawing no. 08 PL (Proposed Front Elevation Plan and Proposed Rear Elevation Plan) Dated 28/10/2024
Drawing no. 09 PL (Proposed Sides Elevations Plans) Dated 28/10/2024 
Drawing no. 10 PL (Existing and Proposed Street Scene Plans)Dated 28/10/2024 
Design & Access Statement Dated 15 October 2024 
Arboricultural Impact Assessment StatementDated Dated 29th June 2024

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Tree Protection - The details and measures as approved in Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statement by MMEnvironmental Ltd shall be installed on site prior to commencement of works and  retained and maintained, until the completion of all site operations.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the side and rear elevations of the extension hereby permitted without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of nearby 
properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy D4 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and D3 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the new side window shall be obscurely glazed and non-opening up to 1.7 m from internal finished floor level.and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 7 - Construction Times - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 8 - The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of a swift nesting box/bricks on the site

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
Applicant should be aware of underground sewer networks and should contact Thames Water for advice.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay.
